New Records: Virat Kohli equalled Sachin Tendulkar's record of 49 ODI centuries, scoring 101 runs.
Ravindra Jadeja took 5 wickets and contributed 29 runs with the bat.
India scored 326 runs, the highest total in the match.
South Africa scored 83 runs, their lowest total in the tournament.
Key Match Events: Ravindra Jadeja took crucial wickets including Quinton de Kock and Aiden Markram.
Marco Jansen, the most expensive bowler in the tournament, was dismissed for 14 runs.
India bowled South Africa out for 83 runs, their lowest score in the World Cup.
Pre-Game Insights: India won the toss and chose to bat first.
Virat Kohli was expected to perform well on his birthday, and he did so with a century.
The match was anticipated as a key contest between Kohli and South Africa's bowlers.
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli expressed gratitude for the win and the record-breaking moment.
Ravindra Jadeja highlighted the importance of team collaboration in the victory.
The win boosted India's confidence ahead of the World Cup semi-finals.
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa's bowlers struggled, with Marco Jansen being the most expensive.
Ngidi suffered a potential hamstring injury, which could impact future matches.
The match was played under challenging conditions, with the pitch assisting the Indian bowlers.
Others: India's victory was seen as a significant milestone in their World Cup campaign.
The match highlighted the dominance of the Indian team, with key players performing exceptionally.
